newsitem.title: INDONESIA: STEADY SAFE TO BUY 19.9 PCT STAKE IN CMNP.
newsitem.headline: STEADY SAFE TO BUY 19.9 PCT STAKE IN CMNP.

text.p: Indonesian transportation firm PT Steady Safe plans to buy up to a 19.9 percent stake in toll road operator PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP), the Jakarta stock exchange said.

The Jakarta stock exchange said in a statement received on Thursday that Steady Safe's shareholders had agreed to elect President Suharto's daughter Siti Hardianti Rukmana, who controls CMNP, as Steady Safe's president commissioner.
Steady Safe, controlled by businessman Jopie Wijaya, operates bus and taxis.
The statement did not give further details.
